intro: Anaphalis pterocaulon var. atrata, commonly known as the blackstem goatweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single blossoms. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, pale green leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Anaphalis pterocaulon var. atrata is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand high temperatures.
